articles.title: IBM beats profit estimates as software business surges, shares rise
articles.description: The company's software segment recorded its biggest revenue jump in five years, as customers prioritized spending on cloud infrastructure amid a rush to adopt the data-intensive generative artificial intelligence technology. "DeepSeek was an initiation that open (source) AI can play a role in the overall GenAI space," IBM Chief Financial Officer James Kavanaugh told Reuters in an interview.
articles.content:
(Reuters) - IBM (IBM) surpassed analysts' estimates for fourth-quarter profit on Wednesday, driven by demand in its high-margin software unit as businesses ramped up IT spending, sending its shares soaring about 10% in extended trading.
The company's... [2170 chars]

articles.title: Anthropic to raise $2 billion in deal valuing AI startup at $60 billion, WSJ says
articles.description: Venture capital firm Lightspeed Venture Partners is leading the funding round, the report said. Anthropic was valued at around $18 billion in a fundraise led by Menlo Ventures in 2024. Amazon.com late last year doubled its investment in the startup to $8 billion, as the e-commerce giant went up against Big Tech rivals in a race to capitalize on generative artificial intelligence technology.
articles.content:
(Reuters) -AI startup Anthropic is in advanced talks to raise $2 billion in a deal valuing the OpenAI rival at $60 billion, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

articles.title: Indian firms tighten AI defences as cybercrime gets more sophisticated
articles.description: Coupled with other sophisticated technologies such as machine learning, artificial intelligence (AI) can both be a boon or a bane. Many cyber criminals are using AI technology to intensify their attacks.
articles.content:
Sophisticated cyberattacks leveraging AI-powered deepfakes, phishing, data manipulation, and malware are on the rise. To combat these complex threats, Indian companies are looking to upgrade their security infrastructure, experts said.
